Files

Class MyFileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • Files.MyFileIO

  • public class MyFileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    A class responsible for reading and writing binary files.
    Author:
    Group 1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyFileIO() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object[] readArrayFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads all objects from the file with the given file name and returns it as an Object array.
      java.lang.Object readObjectFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads the first object from the file with the given file name and returns it.
      void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.Object obj)
      Writes the given object to a file with the given file name.
      void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.Object[] objs)
      Writes the objects in the given array to a file with the given file name.

    • Method Detail

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                        java.lang.Object obj)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Writes the given object to a file with the given file name.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name and path of the file to write to
        obj - the object to write to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file with fileName is not found
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error writing to the file

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                        java.lang.Object[] objs)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Writes the objects in the given array to a file with the given file name.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name and path of the file to write to
        objs - the Object array to write to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file with fileName is not found
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error writing to the file

      • readObjectFromFile

        public java.lang.Object readObjectFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Reads the first object from the file with the given file name and returns it. Whoever calls the method will need to cast it from type Object to its real type
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name and path of the file that is read
        Returns:
        the Object read from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file with fileName is not found
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the file
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object cannot be found

      • readArrayFromFile

        public java.lang.Object[] readArrayFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                            java.io.IOException,
                                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Reads all objects from the file with the given file name and returns it as an Object array. Whoever calls the method will need to cast the Objects to their real type.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name and path of the file that is read
        Returns:
        and Object array with all the objects read from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file with fileName is not found
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading the file
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object cannot be found
